ygData.subject: Re: Kill Stealing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Sean.Stephen@psygnosis.co.uk  To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com  Date: Wednesday, August 04, 1999 4:26
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Sean.Stephen@... <Sean.Stephen@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 04, 1999 4:26 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Kill Stealing


>From: Sean.Stephen@...
>
>Best thing that i did to a kill stealer was to an enchanter in HighHold ..
>he was charming the high level orcs and after my group had beaten about 1/3
>its health from it and taking them to a quiet spot to finish em ... so i
>followed him and cast cancel magic =).. . Next second it was beating the
>cr*p outta this poor guy but after the 3rd time he got the message!


Be careful. I thought that one approach to KS'ing was canceling the
KS's buffs, and canceling the root on his prey. I was told by a teammate
that this was considered a bannable offense by Verant. No, I have no ex
cathedra verification of this.

For the life of me, I don't understand why Verant tolerates -- and even
encourages, though the current kill-allocation algorithm -- the most
antisocial and parasitic of players, and frustrates the 95% who want to play
fair. And it seems to be adding insult to injury that they would ban players
for trying to protect themselves against the KS'ers! Aaaarrrggghhh!

== Gilead, dwarven cleric of Fennin Ro
